page.title: 20Transport in Witney
page.content: The "Blanket Bus" has recently been introduced around Witney.It is a very useful service as Witney is getting bigger and there used to be very few buses .It is especially useful for old people and for people going shopping. It is a mini-bus and seats 16 people. It visits Cogges and other housing estates around Witney every hour and only costs 25pence. There are two vehicles and they operate six days a week (not on Sundays) and the last bus leaves Cogges at 16:40. Getting to Witney from Cogges you need to go a long way round if you drive as there is only one road bridge. There are often traffic jams along Bridge Street. During the day many people walk over the foot bridges. These are mostly women going shopping, young children and some people going to work Soon a new road bridge will be built.
